Proud to support the historic #BuildBackBetter Act - which will:
✅Revitalize our economy
✅Cut taxes for middle class families
✅Lower health care and prescription drug costs
✅Create millions of new jobs
✅Combat the climate crisis
✅Ensure no community is left behind https://t.co/DDHbnRPGZZ

1461542136235581442.text:
✅Bolsters resilience and natural solutions to climate change through a historic investment in coastal restoration, forest management, and soil conservation

And those are just SOME of the highlights.

1461542134499139587.text: ✅Creates a new Civilian Climate Corps to conserve our public lands, bolster community resilience, and address the changing climate, all while putting good-paying union jobs within reach for more Americans

1461542133588971522.text: ✅Advances environmental justice through a new Clean Energy and Sustainability Accelerator that will invest in projects around the country

1461542131244412933.text: ✅Delivers substantial consumer rebates and tax credits to reduce costs for middle class families shifting to clean energy and electrification

1461542129830961155.text: ✅Makes the single largest and most comprehensive investment in affordable housing IN HISTORY

1461542127888961537.text: ✅Makes a transformative investment in Rural America through a new Rural Partnership Program that will empower rural regions, including Tribal Nations and territories, by providing flexible funding for locally led projects

1461542125607260165.text: ✅Increases the maximum Pell Grant by $550 for more the more than 5 million students enrolled in public and private, non-profit colleges

1461542123010940928.text: ✅Expands access to affordable, high-quality education beyond high school. It will make education beyond high school – including training for high-paying jobs available NOW – more affordable

1461542121446510592.text: ✅Empowers communities to develop local economies & create jobs through a pilot of the RECOMPETE Act – legislation I introduced to provide flexible, long-term grant assistance to help communities that have struggled to create jobs & create long-term economic growth & opportunity

1461542119533858819.text: ✅Expands the Child Tax Credit, providing more than 35M households a tax credit up to $3,600/child - helping families cover the cost of food, housing, health care, & transportation. This tax cut has already enabled the largest 1-year reduction in child poverty in American HISTORY

1461542117927538688.text: ✅Extends the expanded Earned Income Tax Credit for ~ 1⃣7⃣ million low-wage workers. The Build Back Better framework will extend the American Rescue Plan’s tripling of the credit for childless workers, benefiting 17 million low-wage workers, many of whom are essential workers

1461542116186853379.text: ✅Permanently improves Medicaid coverage for home care services for seniors and people with disabilities, making the most transformative investment in access to home care in 40 years, when these services were first authorized for Medicaid.

1461542114672660485.text:
✅Delivers affordable, high-quality care for older Americans and people with disabilities in their homes, while supporting the workers who provide this care.

✅Strengthens the Affordable Care Act and reduces health care premiums for 9⃣ MILLION Americans.

1461542112315465743.text: ✅Makes the largest investment in child care in the nation’s history, SAVING most working American families more than HALF of their spending on child care.

1461542108792336388.text:
The #BuildBackBetter Act:
✅ Provides universal and free preschool for all 3- and 4-year-olds, the largest expansion of universal and free education since states and communities across the country established public high school 100 years ago.

1445822037218320385.text:
We need sanity to prevail in DC and for the two parties to work together to prevent default. 

The full faith and credit of our nation should never be in question.  ///

1445822035503067137.text: AND it’s despite the fact that Congressional Republicans and the last Administration racked up nearly $8 trillion in debt – nearly 1/4 of our nation’s total debt – in part to give the very wealthiest Americans a tax giveaway. I don’t say that in a partisan way - it’s just a fact.

1445822033519120387.text:
Senate Republicans have been threatening to filibuster ANY legislation to address the debt limit. 

That’s despite the fact that Mitch McConnell has previously said “America must never default” and that failing to address it would be “playing Russian roulette with our economy.”

1445822031883345922.text:
That’s why I supported legislation that passed the House on September 29 to suspend the debt limit.

Unfortunately, there are some shenanigans occurring in the U.S. Senate that has made the road forward a bit bumpy.

1445822029345673227.text:
((side note: this clip from The West Wing explains it in a far more entertaining way than I could ever))
https://t.co/xrEmqkqAW8

1445822027206574081.text:
In essence, failing to address the debt ceiling is a bit like choosing not to pay the minimum balance on your credit card. 

You can make that choice – but it DEFINITELY has bad consequences for your finances down the road.

1445822025642164226.text:
Recent analyses suggest that failure to act could cost America’s economy as much as 6⃣ MILLION jobs. 

In addition, it would also likely delay payments for critical programs like Social Security, Medicare, and veterans’ benefits.

1445822023763210244.text:
Again – why does that matter? 

Well, nearly every economist across the political spectrum has acknowledged this would damage the economy and make it more expensive for folks to borrow money to buy a car or home, or to start or grow a small business.

1445822021569589249.text: So why is this in the press right now? Well, it’s expected that the Treasury Department will run out of those options to address the debt ceiling by October 18. At that point, if Congress fails to take action, the government would default.

1445822020365824000.text: Raising or suspending the debt limit does NOT authorize new spending but allows the government to pay for ➡️previously made commitments⬅️

1445822018402668545.text:
Our nation is a bit unique in that it puts in law how much debt can be incurred by the U.S. Treasury. 

Why does that matter? Well, it limits the amount the federal government can pay on debt the government has ALREADY borrowed.

1445822016850890755.text:
There’s a fair amount of press attention about the debt ceiling (also known as the debt limit) - especially coming out of DC and the national news media.

What is it? Why does it matter to folks in our region? Is this actually a big deal (hint: yes)?

Let's dig in 🧵⬇️

1444138973660598278.text: Congress can, and should, pass both of these and help America #BuildBackBetter. I’ll keep working toward that end.

1444138972481994753.text: It’s about creating jobs by providing new help to small businesses and by taking action to combat the climate crisis.

1444138971454390274.text: It’s about helping families that are grappling with the costs of child care or caring for an elder parent, that are struggling to pay for health care and prescription drugs, or that can’t afford to pay for college.

1444138970397483010.text: The President’s Build Back Better bill (aka “reconciliation”) is about helping middle class families. It’s about recognizing that middle class families and folks struggling to make ends meet deserve a break.

1444138968962981889.text: It’s about recognizing we can’t compete in a 21st Century economy with 19th & 20th Century infrastructure. The bipartisan infrastructure bill will create good-paying jobs, modernize our nation’s infrastructure, & reduce carbon pollution. Those are priorities worth moving forward

1444138967901868036.text: The bipartisan infrastructure bill is about putting people to work now – and laying the foundation for economic growth over the long haul by investing in roads, bridges, transit, water systems, ports, and broadband.

1444138966844854273.text: There’s been lots of press coverage of deliberations and process in Congress related to the President’s Build Back Better Agenda. But let’s focus on what this is about… it’s about jobs.

1444138965402071042.text:
I’m pushing for Congress to pass both elements of the President’s #BuildBackBetter Agenda.

🧵⬇️ https://t.co/JZJKbiGa5J

1418260728369369089.text: That's why the RECOMPETE Act makes targeted investments in communities that need it most - providing flexible, long-term grant assistance to create jobs and lay the foundation for long-term economic growth and opportunity.

1418260726989340682.text: It had a big impact on me - and I’ve spent most of my adult life trying to figure out how to make sure we are doing a better job of protecting workers and communities so that no one gets left behind in our society and economy.

1418260725483646977.text:
Communities like Port Angeles, where I grew up. 

I was in high school right around the time the timber industry took it on the chin. I saw a lot of my friends’ parents lose their jobs...

1418260724279808004.text: These communities are home to ~1/6 of the US population & have an employment rate of workers ages 25-54 significantly below the natl average. They have been left out of the investment, innovation and opportunity that has instead been concentrated in a handful of major metro areas

1418260722425995269.text: The COVID-19 crisis is exacerbating existing inequities, especially for communities that were already struggling. That's why @ChrisCoons, @HerreraBeutler & I introduced a bold plan to make a long-term federal investment & create jobs in places that are consistently left behind. https://t.co/y2L3F05M4J

1332459136580268034.text: This Thanksgiving season, I hope folks in Congress remember the words of President Kennedy who said, “As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.”

1332459135607185408.text: Folks shouldn’t have to wait any longer. It’s time for Senate Republicans to come to the table and agree to an adequate relief package to support the American people. No more gridlock. No more pausing.

1332459134478929920.text: >8 million Americans have fallen into poverty since May. W/ unemployment benefits expiring & stimulus payment seeming like a distant memory, things will only get worse. That’s why the House passed a relief bill to extend unemployment assistance & provide another round of payments

1332459133644181505.text: During this economic crisis, we’ve seen people lose jobs, lose hours at work, and lose income—all factors exacerbating the threat of homelessness. That’s why the House passed a relief bill to provide rental assistance and protections from eviction and foreclosure.

1332459132906070016.text: What’s more, people shouldn’t be threatened with the loss of their housing because of this pandemic. Nearly 11 million households in America spend more than 50 percent of their income on housing.

1332459131828121600.text: To me, simply put, it is wrong that people are facing hunger this week. According to one nonprofit, nearly 50M Americans could be food insecure this year – including 17M kids. That’s why the House passed a relief bill to provide nutrition assistance to reduce food insecurity.

1332459131014434816.text:
Now, more than ever, Democrats and Republicans need to come together and craft a relief package that meets the needs of Americans who are hurting. 

I have a sense of urgency about seeing a COVID relief bill pass.

1332459129978425345.text:
In the House, we’ve already passed two different bills in recent months aimed at these goals. Unfortunately, the Senate has failed to act. Instead, Leader McConnell has said “let’s pause.” 

But the time for pausing has long needed to end.

1332459129114402817.text: I’m working hard in these final weeks of the year to get a comprehensive COVID-19 relief bill passed that will crush this virus, provide assistance to folks who are unemployed or experiencing housing insecurity, and help small businesses on Main Street.

1332459128242003968.text: It’s been 8 months since a comprehensive COVID-19 relief bill was last passed by Congress. It is shameful that more relief has not been provided to folks – and this Thanksgiving weekend, I’m thinking about the people who need Congress to act.
